In "Casablanca", Humphrey Bogart plays Rick Blaine, an American expatriate who runs a nightclub in Casablanca. The film follows Blaine's adventures in Casablanca over several days as he tries to uncover the real reason why the French government has ordered Blaine and his employees out of the city.
Throughout the film, Blaine is portrayed as a clever and resourceful man who uses his wit and cunning to overcome obstacles and challenges that come his way.

Based on your preferences, I would recommend either "To Have and Have Not" or "Windtalkers".
Both movies are set during World War II and feature American expatriate Harry Morgan who helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.
In "To Have and Have Not", Morgan is tasked with assassinating a renegade Special Forces Colonel who sees himself as a god. The movie follows Morgan on his mission, as he faces various challenges and obstacles along the way.
In "Windtalkers", Morgan is assigned to protect Navajo Marines, who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher. The movie follows Morgan and the Navajo Marines as they work to protect the Navajo people from a group of ruthless outlaws led by a cunning and dangerous gangster named Jack.
In "Cold Mountain", Morgan embarks on a perilous journey back home to Cold Mountain, North Carolina to reunite with his sweetheart. The movie follows Morgan's journey, as he faces various challenges and obstacles along the way.
In both movies, Morgan serves as a central character who is tasked with carrying out important missions or tasks. The movies follow Morgan's journeys, as he faces various challenges and obstacles along the way.

Overall, "To Have and Have Not" and "Windtalkers" are two excellent movies set during World War II and featuring American expatriate Harry Morgan who helps transport a French Resistance leader and his beautiful wife to Martinique while romancing a sensuous lounge singer.

The movie revolves around two notorious outlaws: Doc Holliday (played by Gary Sinatra) and Wild Bill Hickman (played by Tom Hanks).

The movie "Tombstone" directed by George Miller is a thrilling Western adventure that captures the essence of outlaws and the law.
